lines.text: Where's your boyfriend
He's not my boyfriend.
I wouldn't call them boyfriend at your age either.
No, you called them clients

[regarding Charity]
Yeah, well, let's just say she's not my type.
Yeah, I'd say Thelma-Louise
[Paul Lambert's drag-queen]
was more your style!

[about a plate of food that accidentally ended up on the floor]
You can't serve that now!
It's for Shadrach.
Fair enough.

[regarding Sam Dingle]
So... Simple Sam's had a baby, then?
Awww, come on. He was made up!
That lad would be made up if you gave him a yo-yo...
Mother not around?
Mine? No, she's been dead twenty years mate.
It's Francis, isn't it?
Not if you want to keep your teeth.
Cousin of the accused with her kit off, you'll make a bomb.
Unless you want your teeth introduced to your throat, I suggest you shut it.
Fair enough.
[Cain has just told Zak about Debbie]
I've got to stop chewing those leaves.
[Lisa has just punched Zak on the jaw]
They'll put you in the cop car.
Are you dead, Dad?
No, I just feel like it.
[Shadrach has drunk a whole bottle of communion wine]
What do you usually do with him?
Wish he'd never been born!
[Danny Daggert, Robert Sugden and Donna Windsor sits at Viv's café and Danny offers to help with rehearsing their Shakespeare, MacBeth homework]
Donna, is it a Daggart I see before me?
Cain's not the real villain here.
Oh, no, you're welcoming her back with open arms!
[Zak has had a run-in with the new gamekeeper]
He's like a speed camera - always there when you don't want them.
Don't look now, but the speed camera's just walked in.

[to Diane Blackstock]
It's my life they're messing with. You and all.
You drown out here man.

[to Eric Pollard]
65 years on the clock, and not a friend in the world! Enjoy yourr old age, Counsellor Pollard!
Oh, it's like me, I'm never so assertive when I'm on my own. My mirror has had more time lashings. I'm sure it winces every time I go near it.
Probably your face, love!
[Betty starts to laugh and naively, Laurel starts to laugh with her]
Trouble in paradise?
There were no children in the garden of Eden.

[talking to Debbie about math]
Don't let anybody tell you that two wrongs don't make it right.
Has anyone seen me ferret, Spike?
Yeah, like a stretched out rat.
Be honest, Marlon. Am I overbearing?
Weeeell, you do, sort of, lean, towards the, erm, military campaign approach.
A day which has been etched in my memory... as I'm sure it will be in yours. Perhaps Dad would like to tell us all why he had his tongue, down Sadie's throat earlier.

[angrily, after stunned silence]
Is this true?
No... it... it wasn't like that!
You should have heard him! Begging for it, he was. "All this could be yours Sadie!" Hands everywhere. And, like the practised whore she is, she got right into it!
You're sleeping together? You and me father? YOU two?
Why the hell would I do that?
You mercenary gold-digger! Yer sick! You call the man DAD for God's sake!
More chance of a stimulating conversation in a graveyard.
Must've heard you were coming, Eric.
Eric, if you don't belt up, I shall thump you.

[in chuckle]
Sorry? I really am sorry. You must be devastated.
Twerp.

[regarding Carl King]
I've got to face it, Val. It's Chas he wants.
Well, Chas should have been around for him then. Absence makes the heart grow fungus!

[shouting into the pup]
I am not having the menopause! I had it five years ago! Have you all got that through there?
That lad of yours attracts trouble like horse attracts flies and I'm not impressed! It begins at home, it always does! Your parenting skills are obviously on the par with your dress sense.
So, let's just get something clear, you're not a full time poof, you just help when they're busy?

[sarcastically]
Oh that's really witty, Jimmy, really original!
[walks off angrily]
What's the matter, don't you like me aftershave?
Why, did you want a few tips?
Oy, you'll be short of a few teeth in a minute!
Where is she?
She? Narrow it down a bit.
He's looking for Dawn, he's got it into his head she's done something stupid to his car.
I haven't got anything in my head.
Yeah, I can second that.
Face it Jimmy, in my position you'd have done the same thing!
That's where you're wrong, cause me, I've got morals!
Yes, but you haven't got the haulage business, have you?
[sneers]
